intro: Cryptocarya rolletii, commonly known as the New Zealand honeysuckle. It is a flowering plant native to New Zealand, belonging to the Lauraceae family. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal and lowland forests, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Cryptocarya rolletii is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional Māori medicine.
